abstract.p: Adam H Stone letter comments on May 7 article on home sellers passing through their closing costs to purchasers

block.p: The article regarding sellers passing through their closing costs to purchasers [''Surprise! The Price May Grow,'' May 7] hit the nail right on the head. What was once the practice of only sponsors of co-op and condo conversions and developers is now something that more sellers are attempting to institute.

The article regarding sellers passing through their closing costs to purchasers [''Surprise! The Price May Grow,'' May 7] hit the nail right on the head. What was once the practice of only sponsors of co-op and condo conversions and developers is now something that more sellers are attempting to institute.

The article neglects to mention the New York State Transfer Tax, or ''mansion tax,'' regularly imposed on purchasers of residential real property for $1 million or more. This tax is 1 percent of the purchase price and can obviously become quite hefty.
